org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.1.17.zip";s:6:"3.1.18";s:89:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.1.18.zip";s:5:"3.2.0";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.2.0.zip";s:5:"3.2.1";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.2.1.zip";s:5:"3.2.2";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.2.2.zip";s:5:"3.3.1";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.3.1.zip";s:5:"3.3.2";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.3.2.zip";s:5:"3.4.0";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.4.0.zip";s:5:"3.4.1";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.4.1.zip";s:5:"3.5.0";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.5.0.zip";s:5:"3.5.1";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.5.1.zip";s:5:"3.5.2";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.5.2.zip";s:5:"3.5.3";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.5.3.zip";s:5:"3.5.4";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.3.5.4.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:82:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:29:"http://podlove.org/donations/";s:5:"icons";a:3:{s:2:"1x";s:84:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545024";s:2:"2x";s:92:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1545024";s:3:"svg";s:84:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545024";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:7:"podcast";s:11:"recommended";}}s:18:"podlove-web-player";a:28:{s:4:"name";s:18:"Podlove Web Player";s:4:"slug";s:18:"podlove-web-player";s:7:"version";s:6:"5.4.12";s:6:"author";s:40:"<a href="http://podlove.org">Podlove</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:45:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/gerritvanaaken";s:8:"requires";s:5:"4.9.6";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.7.1";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"7.2";s:6:"rating";i:64;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:5;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:4;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:10;s:15:"support_threads";i:1;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:92156;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2021-04-20 7:54am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2012-07-03";s:8:"homepage";s:44:"https://docs.podlove.org/podlove-web-player/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:2880:"<p>Podlove Web Player is a HTML5 based web player for audio and video media files that is optimized and extended for the specific needs of podcasters.<br />
It has a native integration with <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/">Podlove Publisher</a>, can be used as a shortcode and also plays well with Gutenberg Blocks.</p>
<h3>Made for Podcasters</h3>
<ul>
<li>Podcast Chapters</li>
<li>Transcripts</li>
<li>Sharing &amp; Embedding</li>
<li>Download integrated</li>
<li>Audio Controls, including playback speed</li>
<li>Supports multiple audio file formats</li>
<li>Supports live streams</li>
</ul>
<h3>Theming &amp; Templating</h3>
<p>The Player is fully customizable in terms of</p>
<ul>
<li>Theme colors</li>
<li>Font family and weight</li>
<li>Templates and appearance</li>
</ul>
<h3>Subscribe Button Integration</h3>
<ul>
<li>Customizable Podcast Clients</li>
<li>Integration in the Player</li>
</ul>
<h3>Usage</h3>
<p>There are basically four ways to use the Podlove Web Player:</p>
<h4>1 Manual WordPress Shortcode</h4>
<p>Use a simple shortcode in your posts and pages, and the Podlove Web Player will appear, playing any media file you want to assign. Basic usage:</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-web-player
  theme="default"
  config="default"
  title="My episode title"
  subtitle="Episode Subtitle"
  poster="/files/path/to/poster.png"
  chapters="/files/path/to/chapters.json"
  transcripts="/files/path/to/transcripts.json"
  playlist="/files/path/to/playlist.json"
  src="http://mysite.com/mymedia.mp3"
  size="1337"
  show="My show title"
  duration="03:33"
]
</code></pre>
<p>Use an existing post with a media enclosure that is provided from plugins like Blubrry:</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-web-player
  theme="default"
  config="default"
  post="1234"
]
</code></pre>
<p>Or in case you have our <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/">Podlove Publisher</a> installed:</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-web-player
  theme="default"
  config="default"
  publisher="1234"
]
</code></pre>
<h4>2 Using WordPress Gutenberg Blocks</h4>
<p>You can choose between different references, like Podlove Publisher, Blocks or you can add the meta data manually. Right now the latter option is limited to a limited set of attributes, this will be expanded in further releases.</p>
<h4>3 Automatic Integration with Podcasting Engines</h4>
<p>If you are using Podlove Publisher you should be able to select it in the Publisher Player settings.<br />
In case you are still using Blubrry you can simply enable the automatic insertions on enclosures in the settings and choose the position.</p>
<h3>Help &amp; Support</h3>
<p>If you encounter any issue with the plugin or want to request a specific feature please reach out to our <a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Community</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:411:"<ol>
<li>Download the Podlove Web Player Plugin to your desktop.</li>
<li>If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the Plugin folder to your desktop.</li>
<li>With your FTP program, upload the Plugin folder to the wp-content/plugins folder in your WordPress directory online.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins screen and find the newly uploaded Plugin in the list.</li>
<li>Click Activate Plugin to activate it.</li>
</ol>

<ul>
<li>Improve page performance by only adding scripts on pages with a player</li>
<li>Harden lifecycle, only render player once all scripts are available (this may lead to slower page rendering)</li>
</ul>

<li>Fix PHP warnings</li>

<li>Only add api requests to cache</li>

<li>sorry for the inconvenience</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>sorry for the mp4 chaps bug</li>
<li>now it’s working again</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>better compatibility</li>
<li>resume at last position</li>
<li>build script (less requests)</li>
<li>accept chapters as json-file</li>
</ul>

<li>various small changes</li>
</ul>

</ul>

<ul>
<li>fixed flash fallback again</li>
<li>parameter handover improved</li>
<li>encoding issues fixed</li>
</ul>

</ul>

</ul>

<ul>

<li>added standalone player, works without PHP (example HTML/JS included)</li>
<li>moved lots of functionality from PHP to JS</li>
<li>cleaned variables and removed old stuff</li>
<li>CSS improvements</li>
<li>new settings area (yes, again. But now WordPress API compliant)</li>
<li>added FontAwesome for fancy control buttons</li>
<li>added “duration” parameter for displaying duration of last chapter</li>
<li>added “permalink” parameter</li>
<li>added “alwaysShowHours” parameter</li>

<li>added “chaptersVisible” parameter</li>
<li>added “timecontrolsVisible” parameter</li>
<li>added “summaryVisible” parameter</li>
<li>added sample audio files for testing purposes</li>
<li>fresh versions of mediaelementjs and jQuery</li>
</ul>

<li>added: optional listening to WordPress enclosures</li>

<li>lots of bugfixes and improvements</li>

</ul>

</ul>

</ul>

<li>First version on wordpress.org</li>
<li>Full of bugs</li>

ress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.0.8.zip";s:5:"5.0.9";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.0.9.zip";s:5:"5.1.0";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.1.0.zip";s:5:"5.1.1";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.1.1.zip";s:5:"5.1.2";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.1.2.zip";s:5:"5.2.0";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.0.zip";s:5:"5.2.1";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.1.zip";s:5:"5.2.2";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.2.zip";s:5:"5.2.3";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.3.zip";s:5:"5.2.4";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.4.zip";s:5:"5.2.5";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.5.zip";s:5:"5.2.6";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.6.zip";s:5:"5.2.7";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.7.zip";s:5:"5.2.8";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.8.zip";s:5:"5.2.9";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.9.zip";s:5:"5.3.0";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.3.0.zip";s:5:"5.3.1";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.3.1.zip";s:5:"5.4.0";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.0.zip";s:5:"5.4.1";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.1.zip";s:6:"5.4.10";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.10.zip";s:6:"5.4.11";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.11.zip";s:6:"5.4.12";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.12.zip";s:5:"5.4.2";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.2.zip";s:5:"5.4.3";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.3.zip";s:5:"5.4.4";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.4.zip";s:5:"5.4.5";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.5.zip";s:5:"5.4.6";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.6.zip";s:5:"5.4.7";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.7.zip";s:5:"5.4.8";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.8.zip";s:5:"5.4.9";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.9.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:29:"https://podlove.org/donations";s:5:"icons";a:3:{s:2:"1x";s:63:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon.svg?rev=2286308";s:2:"2x";s:71:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=2286308";s:3:"svg";s:63:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon.svg?rev=2286308";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:7:"podcast";s:11:"recommended";}}s:24:"podlove-subscribe-button";a:28:{s:4:"name";s:24:"Podlove Subscribe button";s:4:"slug";s:24:"podlove-subscribe-button";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.3.7";s:6:"author";s:41:"<a href="https://podlove.org">Podlove</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/chemiker";s:8:"requires";s:5:"3.5.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.3.7";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.3";s:6:"rating";i:100;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:2;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:0;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:2;s:15:"support_threads";i:1;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:26517;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2019-10-31 10:24pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-04-15";s:8:"homepage";s:62:"https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/podlove-subscribe-button/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2037:"<p>This plugin allows easy inclusion of the Podlove Subscribe Button. Put it in your sidebar with a simple widget or include the button in pages and/or posts with a simple shortcode.</p>
<h3>About the Podlove Subscribe Button</h3>
<p>The Podlove Subscribe Button allows for simple subscription of podcasts in anybody&#8217;s favorite podcast app right from the browser without having to deal with pesky feed URLs and go on a hunt for feed subscription dialogues.</p>
<p>The button knows how to activate the subscription functionality in all popular podcast apps supporting various operating systems including but not limited to iOS, Android, WindowsPhone, OSX, Windows and Linux.</p>
<p>The button is centrally hosted and gets permanently updated when new podcast apps emerge or when new features are added. Using the button ensures your podcast can easily be subscribed to and presents an ever more popular user interface that your audience gets more and more used to.</p>
<h3>About Podlove</h3>
<p>Podlove is an open source initiative to improve the overall podcasting infrastructure and to come up with simple but helpful standards and tools to make publishing and listening to podcast as easy as possible.</p>
<p>Podlove currently provides:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://publisher.podlove.org" rel="nofollow ugc"><strong><em>Podlove Podcast Publisher</em></strong></a> &#8211; a powerful plugin for WordPress for podcasters to publish metadata-rich podcasts</li>
<li><strong><em>Podlove Web Player</em></strong> &#8211; a podcast-optimized HTML5 web player with chapter support</li>
<li><a href="https://subscribe-button.podlove.org" rel="nofollow ugc"><strong><em>Podlove Subscribe Button</em></strong></a> &#8211; a centrally hosted universal podcast subscribe button for the web</li>
</ul>
<h3>Other Resources</h3>
<ul>
<li>Podlove Project: https://podlove.org/</li>
<li>Podlove Community: https://community.podlove.org/</li>
<li>Documentation: https://docs.podlove.org/</li>
<li>Donate: https://podlove.org/donations/</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:4139:"<h3>Install the plugin</h3>
<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
</ol>
<h3>Configure buttons</h3>
<ol>
<li>Navigate to <code>Settings &gt; Podlove Subscribe Button</code></li>
<li>Fill out all fields, save and grab the shortcode</li>
<li>Add the button to your blog using the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button id="{{yourButtonID}}"]</code> with your button ID, or use the provided Podlove Subscribe Button Widget</li>
</ol>
<h3>Display the Subscribe Button in your Sidebar using a Widget</h3>
<p>Go to <code>Appearance -&gt; Widgets</code> and drag the &#8220;Podlove Subscribe Button&#8221; widget to your sidebar configuration. Select the pre-configured button from the list and determine which style you want. That&#8217;s it. The button should show up in your sidebar. Optionally add a title and description for your widget.</p>
<p>This is the easiest and recommended way of using this plugin especially if you ony want to display a button for a single podcast. For best visibility choose size &#8220;big&#8221; and format &#8220;cover&#8221; to make your Subscribe Button stand out and easily locatable.</p>
<h3>Include the Subscribe Button in WordPress pages using a Shortcode</h3>
<p>If you want to include a Podlove Subscribe Button in a WordPress page (or a post) just put the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button]</code> at the desired position in your text. Use the following shortcode parameters to configure it properly:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>button</code> &#8211; the ID of one of your preconfigured buttons</li>
<li><code>size</code> &#8211; one of &#8216;small&#8217;, &#8216;medium&#8217;, &#8216;big&#8217;</li>
<li><code>width</code> &#8211; specify desired button width in CSS compatibles values or &#8216;auto&#8217; automatic width depending on context.</li>
<li><code>color</code> &#8211; specify the color of the button in a CSS compatible format (keyword, rgb-hex, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla)</li>
<li><code>style</code> &#8211; default is filled, options are &#8216;outline&#8217; and &#8216;frameless&#8217;</li>
<li><code>format</code> &#8211; default is a rectangle, options are &#8216;square&#8217; and &#8216;cover&#8217; (<strong>Note</strong>: &#8216;cover&#8217; has a max size of 300px)</li>
<li><code>hide</code> &#8211; if set to <code>true</code> the button will not be shown (useful if you want to use your own element)</li>
<li><code>language</code> &#8211; specify the language the texts on the button and popup should be in (currently supports &#8216;de&#8217;, &#8216;en&#8217;, &#8216;eo&#8217;, &#8216;fi&#8217;, &#8216;fr&#8217;, &#8216;nl&#8217;, &#8216;zh&#8217; and &#8216;ja&#8217;)</li>
</ul>
<p>Note that if you do not provide one of the attributes the subscribe button will use the globally set default.</p>
<h3>Shortcode Examples</h3>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton1" size="big"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a large button with the podcast logo on top using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton1&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton2" size="medium" width="100pt" language="de"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a small button with a width of 100pt using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton2&#8221; in german. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton3" size="big" width="auto" format="cover"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a big button with a the podcast cover and automatically adjusted using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton3&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton4" format="square" style="frameless"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a small, frameless square button with using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton4&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:1367:"
<h4>I&#8217;m running the Podlove Publisher. Do I need this plugin to display a Subscribe button?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes and No. If you simply want to display a Subscribe Button for your Podcast you publish with the Podlove Publisher you do not need this plugin as the Publisher itself provides this functionality. If you want to display multiple Subscribe Buttons you can use the Subscribe Button plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where do I create those &#8220;Network-wide&#8221; Buttons?</h4>
<p>
<p>You can find the Panel in the Networks Settings Section</p>
</p>
<h4>Does this plugin actually contain the code for the button?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. This plugin just embeds the code that is needed to display the Podlove Subscribe Button. The button itself is served live from api.podlove.org</p>
</p>
<h4>Do I update the plugin to get support for more clients?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. As the Podlove Subscribe Button is hosted centrally, it gets updated regularly independent from this pugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>I am a podcast app developer and would like my app be listed in the button. What do I need to do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Consult the information provided on <a href="https://podlove.org/podlove-subscribe-button" rel="nofollow ugc">the technical information page</a> at podlove.org on how the button works and what app developers need to support and do in order to get listed in the button.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:2490:"<h3>1.3.7 (2019-07-20)</h3>
<ul>
<li>FIXED an issue that prevented the subscribe button to appear</li>
<li>FIXED a XSS vulnerability</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.6 (2018-10-02)</h3>
<ul>
<li>FIXED autowidth value not saving to options correctly</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.5 (2018-09-09)</h3>
<ul>
<li>Replaced the spectrum color selector with WP Color Picker</li>
<li>FIXED multiple color pickers when adding a widget</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.4 (unreleased)</h3>
<ul>
<li>FIXED detection of Publisher plugin (widget naming)</li>
<li>FIXED deprecated WP core functions removed</li>
<li>FIXED fix select button for widget</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.3</h3>
<ul>
<li>Enhanced Support for translation</li>
<li>Fixed an issue that prevented network buttons to be shown</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.2</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed an error that caused notices on some installations</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed an error that caused fatal errors on some installations</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3</h3>
<ul>
<li>Podcast Cover Image can be selected using the WordPress Media Library</li>
<li>When using the Shortcode, the button language can now be set using the language attribute</li>
<li>Enhanced support for button color</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that caused an error message for non-network installations</li>
<li>UI enhancements and further optimizations</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.2.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Various bugfixes</li>
</ul>

<li>Added various options that allow customization of the Subscribe button</li>
<li>Various bugfixes</li>

ton/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545649";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:7:"podcast";s:11:"recommended";}}s:12:"antispam-bee";a:28:{s:4:"name";s:12:"Antispam Bee";s:4:"slug";s:12:"antispam-bee";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.9.4";s:6:"author";s:57:"<a href="https://pluginkollektiv.org">pluginkollektiv</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:46:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/pluginkollektiv";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.7.1";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.2";s:6:"rating";i:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:170;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:1;i:1;i:7;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:181;s:15:"support_threads";i:6;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:5;s:10:"downloaded";i:4517229;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2021-03-10 1:05pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2009-01-10";s:8:"homepage";s:40:"https://antispambee.pluginkollektiv.org/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2482:"<p>Say Goodbye to comment spam on your WordPress blog or website. <em>Antispam Bee</em> blocks spam comments and trackbacks effectively, without captchas and without sending personal information to third party services. It is free of charge, ad-free and 100% GDPR compliant.</p>
<h3>Feature/Settings Overview</h3>
<ul>
<li>Trust approved commenters.</li>
<li>Trust commenters with a Gravatar.</li>
<li>Consider the comment time.</li>
<li>Allow comments only in a certain language.</li>
<li>Block or allow commenters from certain countries.</li>
<li>Treat BBCode links as spam.</li>
<li>Validate the IP address of commenters.</li>
<li>Use regular expressions.</li>
<li>Search local spam database for commenters previously marked as spammers.</li>
<li>Notify admins by e-mail about incoming spam.</li>
<li>Delete existing spam after n days.</li>
<li>Limit approval to comments/pings (will delete other comment types).</li>
<li>Select spam indicators to send comments to deletion directly.</li>
<li>Optionally exclude trackbacks and pingbacks from spam detection.</li>
<li>Optionally spam-check comment forms on archive pages.</li>
<li>Display spam statistics on the dashboard, including daily updates of spam detection rate and a total of blocked spam comments.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Support</h3>
<ul>
<li>Community support via the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/antispam-bee">support forums on wordpress.org</a></li>
<li>Read <a href="https://antispambee.pluginkollektiv.org/documentation/" rel="nofollow ugc">the documentation</a></li>
<li>We don’t handle support via e-mail, Twitter, GitHub issues etc.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Contribute</h3>
<ul>
<li>Active development of this plugin is handled <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow ugc">on GitHub</a>.</li>
<li>Pull requests for documented bugs are highly appreciated.</li>
<li>If you think you’ve found a bug (e.g. you’re experiencing unexpected behavior), please post at the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/antispam-bee">support forums</a> first.</li>
<li>If you want to help us translate this plugin you can do so <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow ugc">on WordPress Translate</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Credits</h3>
<ul>
<li>Author: <a href="https://sergejmueller.github.io/" rel="nofollow ugc">Sergej Müller</a></li>
<li>Maintainers: <a href="https://pluginkollektiv.org" rel="nofollow ugc">pluginkollektiv</a></li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:558:"<ul>
<li>If you don’t know how to install a plugin for WordPress, <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Managing_Plugins#Installing_Plugins" rel="nofollow ugc">here’s how</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Requirements</h3>
<ul>
<li>PHP 5.2.4 or greater</li>
<li>WordPress 4.5 or greater</li>
</ul>
<h3>Settings</h3>
<p>After you have activated <em>Antispam Bee</em> the plugin will block spam comments out of the box. However, you may want to visit <em>Settings → Antispam Bee</em> to configure your custom set of anti-spam options that works best for your site.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:3563:"
<dt id='does%20antispam%20bee%20prevents%20spam%20registrations%20or%20protects%20form%20plugins%3F'>
Does Antispam Bee prevents spam registrations or protects form plugins?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee works best with default WordPress comments. It does not help to protect form plugins and does not prevent spam registrations. Hopefully we can provide better hooks for third party plugins to use Antispam Bee to fill this gap in the forthcoming new major version.</p>
</p>
<dt id='does%20antispam%20bee%20work%20with%20jetpack%2C%20disqus%20comments%20and%20other%20comment%20plugins%3F'>
Does Antispam Bee work with Jetpack, Disqus Comments and other comment plugins?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee works best with default WordPress comments. It is not compatible with Jetpack or Disqus Comments as those plugins load the comment form within an iframe. Thus Antispam Bee can not access the comment form directly.<br />
It also won’t work with any AJAX-powered comment forms.</p>
</p>
<dt id='does%20antispam%20bee%20store%20any%20private%20user%20data%2C%20and%20is%20it%20compliant%20with%20gdpr%3F'>
Does Antispam Bee store any private user data, and is it compliant with GDPR?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee is developed in Europe. You might have heard we can be a bit nitpicky over here when it comes to privacy. The plugin does not save private user data and is 100% compliant with GDPR.</p>
</p>
<dt id='will%20i%20have%20to%20edit%20any%20theme%20templates%20to%20get%20antispam%20bee%20to%20work%3F'>
Will I have to edit any theme templates to get Antispam Bee to work?
</h4>
<p>
<p>No, the plugin works as is. You may want to configure your favorite settings, though.</p>
</p>
<dt id='does%20antispam%20bee%20work%20with%20shortened%20ips%3F'>
Does Antispam Bee work with shortened IPs?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Generally yes. However, commissioning the Antispam Bee plugin for canceled or shortened IP addresses in comment metadata is not recommended. Because the name and the e-mail address of the comments are not unique, an IP address is the only reliable measure. The more complete the stored IP addresses, the more reliable the assignment or detection of spam.</p>
</p>
<dt id='how%20can%20i%20submit%20undetected%20spam%3F'>
How can I submit undetected spam?
</h4>
<p>
<p>If the antispam plugin has passed some spam comments, these comments can be reported for analysis. A <a href="http://goo.gl/forms/ITzVHXkLVL" rel="nofollow ugc">Google table</a> was created for this purpose.</p>
</p>
<dt id='antispam%20bee%20with%20varnish%3F'>
Antispam Bee with Varnish?
</h4>
<p>
<p>If WordPress is operated with Apache + Varnish, the actual IP address of the visitors does not appear in WordPress. Accordingly the Antispam-Plugin lacks the base for the correct functionality. An adaptation in the Varnish configuration file /etc/varnish/default.vcl provides a remedy and forwards the original (not from Apache) IP address in the HTTP header X-Forwarded-For:</p>
<blockquote>
<p>if (req.restarts == 0) {<br />
      set req.http.X-Forwarded-For = client.ip;<br />
  }</p>
</blockquote>
</p>
<dt id='are%20there%20some%20paid%20services%20or%20limitations%3F'>
Are there some paid services or limitations?
</h4>
<p>
<p>No, Antispam Bee is free forever, for both private and commercial projects. You can use it on as many sites as you want. There is no limitation to the number of sites you use the plugin on.</p>
<p>A complete documentation is available on <a href="https://antispambee.pluginkollektiv.org/documentation/" rel="nofollow ugc">pluginkollektiv.org</a>.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:7525:"<h3>2.9.4</h3>
<ul>
<li>Enhancement: Add filter to allow ajax calls</li>
<li>Tweak: Better wording for BBCode feature in plugin description</li>
<li>Tweak: Better screenshots in the plugin directory</li>
<li>Maintenance: Tested up to WordPress 5.7</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.9.3</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with WordPress 5.5</li>
<li>Fixed: Undefined index on spam list page</li>
<li>Tweak: Better wording on settings page</li>
<li>Tweak: AMP compatibility</li>
<li>Tweak: Protect CSS from overwrite through bad themes</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.9.2</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Delete comment meta for deleted old spam. For the cleanup of older orphaned comment meta we suggest the usage of <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-sweep/">WP Sweep</a></li>
<li>Fix: Statistic in dashboard showed wrong value</li>
<li>Tweak: Change autocomplete attribute to &#8220;new-password&#8221;</li>
<li>Tweak: Autoptimize compatibility improved</li>
<li>Tweak: Renamed blacklist/whitelist to a better phrase</li>
<li>Tweak: Added new pattern</li>
<li>Tweak: UI and text optimizations</li>
<li>Tweak: Better compatibility with some server configurations</li>
<li>Tweak: Make spam reason sortable and filterable</li>
<li>Tweak: Add spam reason for manually marked spam</li>
<li>Maintenance: Deleted unused code</li>
<li>Maintenance: Removed Fake IP check (unreliable and producing false positives)</li>
<li>Maintenance: Fix some coding standard issues</li>
<li>Maintenance: Tested up to WordPress 5.4</li>
<li>Maintenance: Tested up to PHP 7.4</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.9.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Improved backend accessibility</li>
<li>Prefilled comment textareas do now work with the honeypot</li>
<li>Compatible with the AMP plugin (https://wordpress.org/plugins/amp/)</li>
<li>Improved dashboard tooltips</li>
<li>Improvements for the language detection API</li>
<li>Scalable IP look up for local spam database</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.9.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Introduction of coding standards.</li>
<li>Switch to franc language detection API for the language check.</li>
<li>Do not longer overwrite the IP address WordPress saves with the comment by using <code>pre_comment_user_ip</code>.</li>
<li>Do not show &#8220;Trust commenters with a Gravatar&#8221; if the &#8220;Show Gravatar&#8221; option is not set.</li>
<li>Skip the checks, when I ping myself.</li>
<li>Fixes some wrong usages of the translation functions.</li>
<li>Use the regular expressions check also for trackbacks.</li>
<li>Add option to delete Antispam Bee related data when plugin gets deleted via the admin interface.</li>
<li>Save a hashed + salted IP for every comment</li>
<li>New check for incoming trackbacks.</li>
<li>Introduction of behat tests.</li>
<li>Updates the used JavaScript library for the statistics widget.</li>
<li>Bugfix in the &#8220;Comment form used outside of posts&#8221; option.</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.8.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>PHP 5.3 compatibility</li>
<li>Bugfix where a spam trackback produced a fatal error</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/8?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.8.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Removed stopforumspam.com to avoid potential GDPR violation</li>
<li>Improves IP handling to comply with GDPR</li>
<li>Improves PHP7.2 compatibility</li>
<li>Fixes small bug on mobile views</li>
<li>Allow more than one language in language check</li>
<li>Minor interface improvements</li>
<li>Remove old russian and Dutch translation files</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/4?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.7.1</h3>

<li>Fixes an incompatibility with Chrome autofill</li>
<li>Fixes some incompatibilities with other plugins/themes where the comment field was left empty</li>

<li>Solve some translation/language issues</li>
<li>A new filter to add languages to the language check</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/6?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.7.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Country check is back again (thanks to Sergej Müller for his amazing work and the service page)</li>
<li>Improved Honeypot</li>
<li>Language check through Google Translate API is back again (thanks to Simon Kraft of https://moenus.net/ for offering to cover the costs)</li>
<li>More default Regexes</li>
<li>Unit Test Framework</li>
<li>Accessibility and GUI improvements</li>
<li>An <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/wiki" rel="nofollow ugc">english documentation</a> is now available, too. Some corrections in the german documentation.</li>
<li>Some bugfixes &#8211; Among other things for WPML compatibility</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/3?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.9</h3>

<li>Updates donation links throughout the plugin</li>
<li>Fixes an error were JavaScript on the dashboard was erroneously being enqueued</li>
<li>Ensures compatibility with the latest WordPress version</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.8</h3>

<h3>2.6.7</h3>

</ul>
<p>For the complete changelog, check out our <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow ugc">GitHub repository</a>.</p>
";s:11:"screenshots";s:1094:"<ol><li><a href="https://ps.w.org/antispam-bee/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=2492113"><img src="https://ps.w.org/antispam-bee/assets/screenshot-1.png?rev=2492113" alt="Block workflow.";}}s:4:"tags";a:5:{s:9:"anti-spam";s:9:"anti-spam";s:8:"antispam";s:8:"antispam";s:10:"block-spam";s:10:"block spam";s:7:"comment";s:7:"comment";s:8:"comments";s:8:"comments";}s:8:"versions";a:29:{s:3:"2.2";s:59:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.2.zip";s:3:"2.3";s:59:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.3.zip";s:3:"2.4";s:59:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.4.zip";s:5:"2.4.1";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.4.1.zip";s:5:"2.4.2";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.4.2.zip";s:5:"2.4.3";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.4.3.zip";s:5:"2.4.4";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.4.4.zip";s:5:"2.4.5";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.4.5.zip";s:5:"2.4.6";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.4.6.zip";s:5:"2.6.0";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.6.0.zip";s:5:"2.6.1";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.6.1.zip";s:5:"2.6.2";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.6.2.zip";s:5:"2.6.3";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.6.3.zip";s:5:"2.6.4";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.6.4.zip";s:5:"2.6.5";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.6.5.zip";s:5:"2.6.6";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.6.6.zip";s:5:"2.6.7";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.6.7.zip";s:5:"2.6.8";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.6.8.zip";s:5:"2.6.9";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.6.9.zip";s:5:"2.7.0";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.7.0.zip";s:5:"2.7.1";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.7.1.zip";s:5:"2.8.0";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.8.0.zip";s:5:"2.8.1";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.8.1.zip";s:5:"2.9.0";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.9.0.zip";s:5:"2.9.1";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.9.1.zip";s:5:"2.9.2";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.9.2.zip";s:5:"2.9.3";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.9.3.zip";s:5:"2.9.4";s:61:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.2.9.4.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:55:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/antispam-bee.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:75:"https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_donations&business=TD4AMD2D8EMZW";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:64:"https://ps.w.org/antispam-bee/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=977629";s:2:"2x";s:64:"https://ps.w.org/antispam-bee/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=977629";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:3:"any";s:11:"recommended";}}s:15:"ultimate-member";a:28:{s:4:"name";s:82:"Ultimate Member – User Profile, User Registration, Login &amp; Membership Plugin";s:4:"slug";s:15:"ultimate-member";s:7:"version";s:6:"2.1.19";s:6:"author";s:56:"<a href="http://ultimatemember.com/">Ultimate Member</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:45:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/ultimatemember";s:8:"requires";s:3:"5.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.7.1";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:6:"rating";i:88;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:977;i:4;i:62;i:3;i:28;i:2;i:37;i:1;i:130;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:1234;s:15:"support_threads";i:470;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:418;s:10:"downloaded";i:4936036;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2021-04-20 2:43pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-01-21";s:8:"homepage";s:26:"http://ultimatemember.com/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:9623:"<h4>Best User Profile &amp; Membership Plugin for WordPress</h4>
<p>Ultimate Member is the #1 user profile &amp; membership plugin for WordPress. The plugin makes it a breeze for users to sign-up and become members of your website. The plugin allows you to add beautiful user profiles to your site and is perfect for creating advanced online communities and membership sites. Lightweight and highly extendible, Ultimate Member will enable you to create almost any type of site where users can join and become members with absolute ease.</p>
<h4>Features of the plugin include:</h4>
<ul>
<li>Front-end user profiles</li>
<li>Front-end user registration</li>
<li>Front-end user login</li>
<li>Custom form fields</li>
<li>Conditional logic for form fields</li>
<li>Drag and drop form builder</li>
<li>User account page</li>
<li>Custom user roles</li>
<li>Member directories</li>
<li>User emails</li>
<li>Content restriction</li>
<li>Conditional nav menus</li>
<li>Show author posts &amp; comments on user profiles</li>
<li>Developer friendly with dozens of actions and filters</li>
</ul>
<p>Read about all of the plugin&#8217;s features at <a href="https://ultimatemember.com" rel="nofollow ugc">Ultimate Member</a></p>
<h4>Paid Extensions</h4>
<p>Ultimate Member has a range of extensions that allow you to extend the power of the plugin. You can purchase all of these extensions at a significant discount with our <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/pricing/" rel="nofollow ugc">All Access Pass</a> or you can purchase extensions individually.</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-notes/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Notes</a> &#8211; Allow users to create public and private notes from their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/profile-tabs/" rel="nofollow ugc">Profile Tabs</a> &#8211; Allow to add the custom tabs to profiles</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-locations/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Locations</a> &#8211; Allow to display users on a map on the member directory page and allow users to add their location via their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/unsplash/" rel="nofollow ugc">Unsplash</a> &#8211; Allow users to select a profile cover photo from <a href="https://unsplash.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">Unsplash</a> from their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-bookmarks/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Bookmarks</a> &#8211; Allow users to bookmark content from your website</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-photos/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Photos</a> &#8211; Allow users to upload photos to their profile</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/groups/" rel="nofollow ugc">Groups</a> &#8211; Allow users to create and join groups around shared topics, interests etc.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/private-content/" rel="nofollow ugc">Private Content</a> &#8211; Display private content to logged in users that only they can access</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-tags/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Tags</a> &#8211; Lets you add a user tag system to your website</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/social-activity/" rel="nofollow ugc">Social Activity</a> &#8211; Let users create public wall posts &amp; see the activity of other users</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/woocommerce/" rel="nofollow ugc">WooCommerce</a> &#8211; Allow you to integrate WooCommerce with Ultimate Member</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/private-messages/" rel="nofollow ugc">Private Messages</a> &#8211; Add a private messaging system to your site &amp; allow users to message each other</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/followers/" rel="nofollow ugc">Followers</a> &#8211; Allow users to follow each other on your site and protect their profile information</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/real-time-notifications/" rel="nofollow ugc">Real-time Notifications</a> &#8211; Add a notifications system to your site so users can receive real-time notifications</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/social-login/" rel="nofollow ugc">Social Login</a> &#8211; Let users register &amp; login to your site via Facebook, Twitter, G+, LinkedIn, Instagram and Vkontakte (VK.com)</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/bbpress/" rel="nofollow ugc">bbPress</a> &#8211; With the bbPress extension you can beautifully integrate Ultimate Member with bbPress</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/mailchimp/" rel="nofollow ugc">MailChimp</a> &#8211; Allow users to subscribe to your MailChimp lists when they signup on your site and sync user meta to MailChimp</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/user-reviews/" rel="nofollow ugc">User Reviews</a> &#8211; Allow users to rate &amp; review each other using a 5 star rate/review system</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/verified-users/" rel="nofollow ugc">Verified Users</a> &#8211; Add a user verification system to your site so user accounts can be verified</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/mycred/" rel="nofollow ugc">myCRED</a> &#8211; With the myCRED extension you can integrate Ultimate Member with the popular myCRED points management plugin</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/notices/" rel="nofollow ugc">Notices</a> &#8211; Alert users to important information using conditional notices</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/profile-completeness/" rel="nofollow ugc">Profile Completeness</a> &#8211; Encourage or force users to complete their profiles with the profile completeness extension</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/friends/" rel="nofollow ugc">Friends</a> &#8211; Allows users to become friends by sending &amp; accepting/rejecting friend requests</li>
</ul>
<h4>Free Extensions</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/jobboardwp/" rel="nofollow ugc">JobsBoardWP</a> &#8211; This free extension integrates Ultimate Member with the job board plugin <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/jobboardwp">JobBoardWP</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/forumwp/" rel="nofollow ugc">ForumWP</a> &#8211; This free extension integrates Ultimate Member with the forum plugin <a href="https://forumwpplugin.com" rel="nofollow ugc">ForumWP</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/terms-conditions/" rel="nofollow ugc">Terms &amp; Conditions</a> &#8211; Add a terms and condition checkbox to your registration forms &amp; require users to agree to your T&amp;Cs before registering on your site.</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/google-recaptcha/" rel="nofollow ugc">Google reCAPTCHA</a> &#8211; Stop bots on your registration &amp; login forms with Google reCAPTCHA</li>
<li><a href="https://ultimatemember.com/extensions/online-users/" rel="nofollow ugc">Online Users</a> &#8211; Display what users are online with this extension</li>
</ul>
<h4>Theme</h4>
<p>Our official <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/theme/" rel="nofollow ugc">theme</a> is purpose built for websites that have logged in and out users. The <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/theme/" rel="nofollow ugc">theme</a> has deep integration with Ultimate Member plugin and the extensions, different header designs for logged-in/out users and works alongside the Beaver Builder and Elementor page builders.</p>
<h4>Our other plugins</h4>
<p>In addition to Ultimate Member, we also have two other plugins: <a href="https://forumwpplugin.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">ForumWP</a> and <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/jobboardwp">JobBoardWP</a>.</p>
<h4>ForumWP</h4>
<p><a href="https://forumwpplugin.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">ForumWP</a> is a forum plugin which adds an online forum to your website, allowing users to create topics and write replies. Forums are a great way to build and grow an online community.</p>
<h4>JobBoardWP</h4>
<p><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/jobboardwp">JobBoardWP</a> is a job board plugin which adds a modern job board to your website. Display job listings and allow employers to submit and manage jobs all from the front-end.</p>
<h4>Development * Translations</h4>
<p>If you&#8217;re a developer and would like to contribute to the source code of the plugin you can do so via our <a href="https://github.com/ultimatemember/ultimatemember" rel="nofollow ugc">GitHub Repository</a>.</p>
<p>Want to add a new language to Ultimate Member? Great! You can contribute via <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/ultimate-member" rel="nofollow ugc">translate.wordpress.org</a>.</p>
<p>If you are a developer and you need to know the list of UM Hooks, make this via our <a href="https://docs.ultimatemember.com/article/1324-hooks-list" rel="nofollow ugc">Hooks Documentation</a>.</p>
<p>If you are a developer and you need to know the structure of our code, make this via our <a href="https://ultimatemember.com/php-docs/" rel="nofollow ugc">Documentation API</a>.</p>
<h4>Documentation &amp; Support</h4>
<p>Got a problem or need help with Ultimate Member? Head over to our <a href="http://docs.ultimatemember.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">documentation</a> and perform a search of the knowledge base. If you can’t find a solution to your issue then you can create a topic on the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/ultimate-member">support forum</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:268:"<ol>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>That&#8217;s it. Go to Ultimate Member &gt; Settings to customize plugin options</li>
<li>For more details, please visit the official <a href="http://docs.ultimatemember.com/" rel="nofollow ugc">Documentation</a> page.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:1614:"
<dt id='do%20i%20need%20to%20know%20any%20coding%20to%20use%20this%20plugin%3F'>
Do I need to know any coding to use this plugin?
</h4>
<p>
<p>No, we have built Ultimate Member to be extremely easy to use and does not require you to manually build shortcodes or have any coding knowledge.</p>
</p>
<dt id='is%20ultimate%20member%20mobile%20responsive%3F'>
Is Ultimate Member mobile responsive?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member is designed to adapt nicely to any screen resolution. It includes specific designs for phones, tablets and desktops.</p>
</p>
<dt id='is%20ultimate%20member%20multi-site%20compatible%3F'>
Is Ultimate Member multi-site compatible?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member works great on both single site and multi-site WordPress installs.</p>
</p>
<dt id='does%20the%20plugin%20work%20with%20any%20wordpress%20theme%3F'>
Does the plugin work with any WordPress theme?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. Ultimate Member will work with any properly coded theme. However, some themes may cause conflicts with the plugin. If you find a styling issue with your theme please create a post in the community forum.</p>
</p>
<dt id='does%20the%20plugin%20work%20with%20caching%20plugins%3F'>
Does the plugin work with caching plugins?
</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin works with popular caching plugins by automatically excluding Ultimate Member pages from being cached. This ensures other visitors to a page will not see the private information of another user. However, if you add features of Ultimate Member to other pages you have to exclude those pages from being cached through your cache plugin settings panel.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:120390:"<h4>Important:</h4>
<ul>
<li>To learn more about version 2.1 please see this <a href="https://docs.ultimatemember.com/article/1512-upgrade-2-1-0" rel="nofollow ugc">docs</a></li>
<li>UM2.1+ is a significant update to the Member Directories&#8217; code base from 2.0.x. Please make sure you take a full-site backup with restore point before updating the plugin</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.19: April 20, 2021</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Endless JS loop when filtering on Member Directory page</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.18: April 19, 2021</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Endless JS loop when filtering on Member Directory page</li>
<li>Fixed: Regular expression for registration form and username field (added ability to use spaces) (#812)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.17: April 14, 2021</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added: Activation link expiration setting (#803)</li>
<li>Added: &#8216;Owner and specific roles&#8217; privacy type for the Profile tabs (#773)</li>
<li>Added: Hooks <code>um_before_email_notification_sending</code> and <code>um_after_email_notification_sending</code> regarding #743 pull-request</li>
<li>Added: Hooks for integration member directory filters with different conditions for query to DB</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Editing private profiles capability. Removed the priority for &#8220;Can edit other member accounts?&#8221; capability when the account is private. (#805)</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP notice when the admin filtering field has the not array default value (e.g. bool)</li>
<li>Fixed: The conflict with <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-blog/">Disable Blog</a> plugin regarding this <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/ultimate-member-file-image-download/">issue</a>. <code>download_routing</code> callback has the highest priority now.</li>
<li>Fixed: Fields privacy functionality. This function <code>um_can_view_field()</code> has been rewritten (#780)</li>
<li>Fixed: Fields privacy + form validation functionality. Skip the field&#8217;s validation that aren&#8217;t visible on the form based on the privacy settings (#795)</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP notice in the confirm password label <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/undefined-index-label-php-notice/">wp.org thread</a></li>
<li>Fixed: Confirm password placeholder when label is empty</li>
<li>Fixed: Permanently deleting form&#8217;s field (#786)</li>
<li>Fixed: Default value with comma for checkbox field-type (#729)</li>
<li>Fixed: Gutenberg blocks conditional settings (#793)</li>
<li>Fixed: Getting active Profile tab when some of them are hidden</li>
<li>Fixed: Restricted content message is showing twice and removing header, avoid the conflicts with themes that use &#8216;the_content&#8217; filter in header or footer (#799)</li>
<li>Fixed: &#8220;Is required&#8221; validation for the multiselect field-type when it&#8217;s empty on submit</li>
<li>Fixed: Using &#8216;wp_login_failed&#8217; hook, added 2nd parameter required since WordPress 5.4 version (#810)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.16: March 10, 2021</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added: General and role setting to avoid indexing users&#8217; profiles</li>
<li>Added: <code>um_prepare_user_results_array_meta</code> hook and the 2nd argument for <code>um_prepare_user_results_array</code> hook for handle $user_ids based on getting members query</li>
<li>Added: Change password email when the password has been reset</li>
<li>Added: jQuery v3 compatibility</li>
<li>Added: An option &#8220;Administrator&#8221; in a menu settings to make the menu visible for administrators only</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Creating and removing usermeta data with <code>password_rst_attempts</code> key, just update if exists for now</li>
<li>Fixed: Using &#8216;edit_users&#8217; capability instead of &#8216;manage_options&#8217; for approve|reject membership</li>
<li>Fixed: Using &#8216;manage_options&#8217; capability instead of &#8216;delete_users&#8217; for switching between members</li>
<li>Fixed: Using myCRED points metakeys in UM usermeta table</li>
<li>Fixed: Empty icons are shown in the popup &#8220;Choose from&#8230; available icons&#8221;</li>
<li>Fixed: Member Directory slider filter with NaN or decimal range</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP notices and warnings</li>
<li>Fixed: Security vulnerability with User Account page and password field</li>
<li>Fixed: User creating without username but based on first+last name with not-ASCII symbols</li>
<li>Fixed: Password reset hash generating more than 1 time</li>
<li>Fixed: Random order type translation string on the member directory</li>
<li>Fixed: Resize and compress images when uploading on User Profile images fields or user wall</li>
<li>Fixed: Displaying more than 1 UM popups on the same page</li>
<li>Fixed: UM dropdown.js position calculation</li>
<li>Fixed: Select2 dropdown block position calculation</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Tweaks:</p>
<ul>
<li>Updated: Select2 to 4.0.13 version</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.15: December 24, 2020</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Conditional logic for the form fields without metakeys</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.14: December 22, 2020</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added a tooltip with meta key name for fields in a form settings</li>
<li>Added <code>Administrator</code> user role to a restriction setting (to make the content visible only for <code>Administrator</code> role)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added third parameter $args to the action hook for Profile Tab redirections <code>um_user_after_updating_profile</code></li>
<li>Fixed issues with fields without metakeys when trying to display them by the hook</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notices/warnings</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.13: December 8, 2020</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added: <code>um_member_directory_cover_image_size</code> hook with ability to change the cover photo size on the member directory</li>
<li>Added: <code>um_member_directory_avatar_image_size</code> hook with ability to change the profile photo size on the member directory</li>
<li>Added: <code>um_member_directory_get_members_allow</code> JS hook for 3rd-party integration with the member directory. You could use a time throttle until some data is loaded</li>
<li>Added: Notice about the fields&#8217; conditional logic rules + small CSS enhancements</li>
<li>Added: Invalid nonce validation on Login and Registration pages instead of wp_die()</li>
<li>Added: Privacy settings for the Divider field type (#688)</li>
<li>Added: Ability for the integration with Gutenberg Block restriction settings (extends the block restriction settings via 3rd-party plugins)</li>
<li>Added: Strings translations</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Upgrade process on websites where a hosting locks the frequent AJAX requests (added default JS throttle between requests)</li>
<li>Fixed: Getting page content of the GDPR privacy policies</li>
<li>Fixed: Password strength validation for Unicode symbols</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with apostrophe options in the multiselect/checkbox fields (#689)</li>
<li>Fixed: Translation for Password field&#8217;s label</li>
<li>Fixed: Download Personal Data URL</li>
<li>Fixed: Vulnerability with timestamp field on UM Forms (the hidden field with name=&#8217;timestamp&#8217; is deprecated)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Tweaks:</p>
<ul>
<li>There are changed PHP’s intval(), strval(), floatval(), and boolval() typecasting functions to (int), (string), (float) and (bool) regarding <a href="https://make.wordpress.org/core/2020/11/20/miscellaneous-developer-focused-changes-in-wordpress-5-6/" rel="nofollow ugc">this doc</a>.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed member directory sorting</li>

<li>Fixed cleaning user old uploads</li>

<li>Fixed &#8220;get_profile_photo_size&#8221; function (avoid PHP notice with array_combine)</li>
<li>Fixed password reset/change form when other forms are initialized at the same page</li>
<li>Fixed getting extension updates on multisites</li>
<li>Fixed the &#8216;wp_authenticate_user&#8217; filter&#8217;s variables (changed username string to WP_User object)</li>
<li>Fixed SEO link canonical for the profile page</li>
<li>Fixed displaying error &amp; notice when the text is empty</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>

<ul>

(it makes the same for {site_url}/user and {site_url}/user/{user_slug} )</li>

<h4>2.0.44: May 08, 2019</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added automatically template saver when you upgrade your theme</li>
<li>Added default value for Date and Time user profile fields</li>
<li>Updated Scroll library</li>
<li>Added REST API v2 class with new query vars. There is an ability to select v1 or v2 for use. For old users v1 is default, for new users v2</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Added nocache headers to reset password form</li>
<li>Email templates saving to child theme, if parent theme already has email template files</li>
<li>Email templates locate in the default plugin folder with active WPML</li>
<li>Form builder with some predefined form fields, which had different keys/metakeys (currently use the same)</li>
<li>Logout redirect with active WPML</li>
<li>Fixed $_SERVER usage when WP-CLI using</li>
<li>Extended integration for UM field value</li>
<li>um_user function avoid loop when &#8216;display name&#8217; and &#8216;full name&#8217; used</li>
<li>Restriction options for Terms and access on front-end</li>
<li>Plugin/Theme upgrader</li>
<li>Remove duplicate data &#8216;user_login&#8217; from metadata</li>
<li>Replace placeholders duplicates</li>
<li>Password Reset link regeneration</li>
<li>Fixed issues with scroll on mobile devices</li>
<li>Fixed multisite activation</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Deprecated:</p>
<ul>
<li>&#8220;Is Account page?&#8221; and &#8220;Is User page?&#8221; options for WPML integration ( because WPML translations works properly )</li>
</ul>
</li>

<li>Changed backend forms/fields to WP native styles</li>
<li>Changed Content Restriction feature for posts, taxonomies, menus</li>
<li>Changed Email Notifications settings and using templates logic</li>
<li>Deprecated Redux Framework</li>
<li>Deprecated old unusable options</li>
<li>Deprecated old unusable forms metadata</li>
<li>Deprecated old unusable member directories metadata</li>
<li>Deprecated old unusable user roles metadata</li>
<li>Optimized registration/upgrade profile process (some hook deprecated)</li>
<li>Optimized some code parts, deprecated some functions</li>
<li>Updated <code>FontAwesome</code> library</li>
<li>Removed addons to separate extensions</li>
<li>Created Plugin Updater for getting updates and license details from Shop</li>
<li>Increased integration abilities, added new hooks (see new Hooks Docs + PHP documentation);</li>
<li>Integrated plugin activation, user creation processes with multisite</li>
<li>Make dependencies with extensions</li>
<li>OOP structure without procedural methods for wp-admin side;</li>
</ul>
</li>

<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed avatars on some SSL installs</li>
<li>Fixed some vulnerabilities</li>
<li>Fixed integrations with core/extensions</li>

<li>Fixed textdomains for translations</li>
<li>Fixed integration with Woocommerce, SEO Framework, WPML</li>
<li>Fixed navigation menu items custom fields (<code>Mega Menu</code>, etc. compatibility)</li>
<li>Fixed theme conflicts with UM js libraries</li>

</ul>

<h4>1.3.83: February 20, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>

</li>
<li>

<h4>1.3.73: November 17, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Adds a filter hook to modify the submitted details on registration process
<ul>
<li><code>um_before_save_filter_submitted</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds a filter hook to disable canonical link in header
<ul>
<li><code>um_allow_canonical__filter</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds a filter hook to modify the auto-generated email address on registration process
<ul>
<li><code>um_user_register_submitted__email</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds filter hooks to modify locale, language file path and textdomain
<ul>
<li><code>um_language_textdomain</code></li>
<li><code>um_language_locale</code></li>
<li><code>um_language_file</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds filter hook to modify the data of selected value:
<ul>
<li><code>um_is_selected_filter_data</code></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds new select/multi-select options to retrieve options from a callback.
<ul>
<li>In the form builder, edit or add a select/multi-select field and add your callback function in <code>Choices callback</code> field to get populated.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds parent select field option to dynamically populate another select field.
<ul>
<li>If <code>Choices Callback</code> option is set in the field settings,  the <code>Parent Option</code> triggers an Ajax request to populate the child options on <code>change</code> event.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Updates <code>um.min.js</code> file.</li>
<li>Updates <code>en_US</code> translation file.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Removes notices from WPCLI console.</li>
<li>Removes notices from edit profile mode</li>
<li>Removes autocomplete from search filter fields</li>
<li>Fix translation strings of search filters on a member directory</li>
<li>Fix email notifications not sending on registration process</li>
<li>Fix field selection with special characters on form submission</li>
<li>Fix assigning of role on register submission process</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixes a bug where Users queue count in the Admin &gt; <code>All Users / Users</code> menu doesn&#8217;t update when a user account is in <code>pending user review</code> and gets deleted.</li>

<li>Fixes a bug to disable the query with hiding account on member directory</li>

<li>Fixes a typo in Welcome Email template.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where login form redirection is set to <code>wp-admin/admin-ajax.php</code> instead of the current page when loaded via ajax.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where uninstall link doesn&#8217;t load.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to redirect users to correct URL after login based from login options.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where non-logged in users are not able to access the profile page when <code>Global Site Access</code> is set to <code>Site accessible to Logged In Users</code>.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to modify the login redirection url especially when DOING_AJAX is defined.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug to retrieve correct community roles per site in a Multisite Network setup.</li>
</ul>
</li>

<h4>1.3.69: September 08, 2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>Adds a system information tool for support purposes</li>
<li>Adds a new option to disable generating profile slugs on every load of member directory pages.
<ul>
<li>Located in UM &gt; Settings &gt; Advanced &gt; Stop generating profile slugs in member directory.</li>
<li>This improves the performance when loading profiles in directories. It generates profile slug on Profile Update ( front and back-end ), Registration Process and viewing the Users in the back-end.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Adds new filter hook <code>um_activate_url</code> to modify the account activation url.</li>

<li>Fixed: admin notifications are in plain text format</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.0.29: January 28, 2015</h4>

<li>New: added option to add text to dividers (which can be added using the drag-and-drop form builder)</li>
<li>New: security improvement: added whitelisted IP(s) option to allow you to access the WP-admin screen always (prevents lockout)</li>
<li>New: added filter hook um_whitelisted_wpadmin_access to control access to wp-admin login screens (for developers)</li>
<li>New: added custom css option to apply extra css styling rules from plugin settings</li>
<li>New: added custom css option to each form allowing you to apply extra styling rules per form</li>
<li>New: added option to customize profile fields area width (per form basis) besides global option</li>
<li>Tweak: compatibility with default permalinks (Pretty permalinks are strongly recommended though!)</li>
<li>Tweak: improved the function that gets user IP address</li>
<li>Tweak: performance: inline css from the plugin is automatically compressed/minified</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed: important bugfix with profile editing</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.22: January 25, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: option to set maximum profile fields area width</li>
<li>New: ajax functions for future development use</li>
<li>Tweak: improved profile permalinks for e-mail based usernames</li>
<li>Tweak: disable user from editing username (If admin put the username field by mistake in profile)</li>
<li>Tweak: minor css changes</li>
<li>Fixed: ability to clear conditional logic from fields in backend</li>
<li>Fixed: corrected spacing issue in a multi-column layout in profile</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.21: January 24, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Added ajax action hook for development use</li>
<li>New: Extended profile hooks</li>
<li>New: you can restrict / apply access control to woocommerce shop page</li>
<li>Fixed: content restriction for woocommerce shop page</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.20: January 24, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Custom email is sent to user after resetting/changing password</li>
<li>New: Added action/filter hooks to profile</li>
<li>Tweak: Improved a few core functions</li>
<li>Fixed: Encoding issue with non-english sites fixed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.19: January 23, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Border thickness option for members directory</li>
<li>New: Option to show/hide forgot password link on login form</li>
<li>Tweak: Capital initials on members directory</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with row styling in form builder</li>
<li>Fixed: Conditional logic bug fixes</li>
<li>Fixed: Icon for conditional rules in backend</li>
<li>Fixed: php warning in debug mode</li>
<li>Fixed: Mobile/phone number validation fixed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.18: January 23, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Issue with drag and drop form builder</li>
<li>Fixed: Form builder trash icon in backend</li>
<li>Fixed: Minor css adjustments in frontend</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.17: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: WordPress Multi-site compatibility for user uploads and photos</li>
<li>Fixed: Searching members by username or email in directory (partial search supported)</li>
<li>Fixed: Anonymous tracking</li>
<li>Fixed: Minor css fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.16: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Settings page: tracking popup removed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.15: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: User profiles now show a cool message if the user profile field area is empty</li>
<li>New: Added &#8216;visibility&#8217; setting to all field types in backend</li>
<li>Tweak: Members search function supports partial search matching</li>
<li>Tweak: Deleting photo or file removes file from server</li>
<li>Tweak: Deleting a user will delete all his personal uploads from the server</li>
<li>Fixed: Duplicate tooltip for password field has been removed</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.10: January 22, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Template tags for welcome e-mail</li>
<li>Fixed: {submitted_registration} e-mail template tag</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.0: January, 2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>First official release!</li>
</ul>

1:15pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2018-08-19";s:8:"homepage";s:59:"https://www.kadencewp.com/product/kadence-gutenberg-blocks/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:6474:"<p>This plugin adds custom blocks and options to extend Gutenberg&#8217;s editing capabilities so you can create custom layouts and more engaging content. This plugin is meant to be a toolkit that makes the WordPress block editor capable of creating content usually only possible through popular page builder plugins. For example, with the <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/row-layout-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">Kadence Row Layout Block</a> you can better control columns for different screen sizes plus it gives you full row editing tools like padding, backgrounds, overlays with gradients, vertical-align and much more.</p>
<h4>Try Kadence Blocks</h4>
<p><a href="http://demo.kadencethemes.com/kadence-blocks/" rel="nofollow ugc">Demo Testing</a></p>
<h4>Custom Blocks Include</h4>
<ul>
<li>Row Layout &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/row-layout-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
<li>Advanced Gallery &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/custom-blocks/advanced-gallery/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
<li>Form &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/form-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
<li>Advanced Heading &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/advanced-heading-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
<li>Advanced Button &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/advanced-button-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
<li>Tabs &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/tabs-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
<li>Accordion &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/accordion-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
<li>Testimonials &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/testimonial-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
<li>Icon &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/icon-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
<li>Spacer / Divider &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/spacer-divider-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
<li>Info Box &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/info-box-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
<li>Icon List &#8211; <a href="https://www.kadenceblocks.com/icon-list-block/" rel="nofollow ugc">demo</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>Video Tutorial</h4>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' width='640' height='360' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/SYb24ncjVsY?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;fs=1&#038;hl=en-US&#038;autohide=2&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;' sandbox='allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-popups allow-presentation'></iframe></span></p>
<h4>Key Block Features</h4>
<p>The Row Layout block can have 1-6 columns, and any other blocks can be nested inside. So as a single column block, it&#8217;s a robust wrapper because you can create very custom backgrounds and define padding, margin, and dividers both for desktop and mobile layouts.</p>
<p>The Advanced Gallery block allows you to add photo galleries in a masonry, grid, carousel, fluid width carousel or slider style. Enjoy four different optional caption locations, each with options to style font, background, etc.  Within each gallery, you can define the thumbnail ratio, add an image filter, set a border radius, and add box shadows.  You can make each image a custom link to another page or website. Or you can easily enable a built-in lightbox.  Plus you can select which image size to use for your thumbnails, and lightbox image for ultimate performance.</p>
<p>The Advanced Heading block provides full control for your headings, including font family (all google fonts), font weight, font style, font size (with tablet and mobile options), line height, color, letter spacing, alignment, and margin. Plus you can define part of the heading as a highlight and style it uniquely.</p>
<p>The Advanced Button block allows you to have up to five buttons side by side. You can control each individually, both with static and hover styles, and each button can have an added icon next to the text. This block even supports video links that open in a popup all built in!</p>
<p>The Tabs block is highly customizable with unique tab title settings for spacing, color, icons, and text. You can set up vertical or horizontal tabs, plus there are options to switch to an accordion setup for mobile. Each tab content is an empty canvas able to contain any other block within it.</p>
<p>The Testimonial block has four built-in preset styles to choose from and allows you to add a carousel or grid of testimonials right into your page or post. You can then customize the colors, fonts, size, border, and shadow to your liking.</p>
<p>The Icon block enables you to add an SVG icon right into your page. There are over 1500 icons to choose from, and with each, you can control the size, color, background, border and add a link.</p>
<p>The Spacer / Divider block allows you to optionally show a divider inside an area with a drag-able height. The divider has style options allowing you to set the width, height, color, line style, and opacity.</p>
<p>The Info Box Block is a box link containing an icon or image and optionally a title, description and &#8220;learn more&#8221; text. Configure padding, fonts, backgrounds, borders, and style static and hover colors even show a box shadow.</p>
<h4>Editor Max Width</h4>
<p>One of the challenges with creating column and row layouts in Gutenberg is the width of the editor in your admin. By default, Gutenberg uses a 650px max width for the content editor. When adding text to a sidebar template, this works great, as the max width in the editor is comparable to the content width when using a sidebar. However, for content going into pages where you don&#8217;t have a sidebar, it is a poor representation of what you are going to get on the front end of your site. Not to mention, it makes for a cramped space to work in if you are trying to manage a row with three columns.</p>
<p>In an effort to create an easier way to use Gutenberg in a more &#8220;page building experience&#8221; we created a simple method that allows you to change the default max width for pages and posts, as well as individually through a page by page setting.</p>
<h4>Source files</h4>
<p><a href="https://github.com/kadencewp/kadence-blocks" rel="nofollow ugc">github</a></p>
<h4>Support</h4>
<p>We are happy to help as best we can with questions! Please use the support forums.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:94:"<p>Install the plugin into the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> folder, and activate it.</p>
